# Snowplow's dbt example project - custom base

The purpose of this project is to show how you could use Snowplow's dbt packages found in dbt's [package hub](https://hub.getdbt.com/snowplow/) in your existing dbt project. Specifically, this project shows how you could customise your base tables to include custom entities, and how to introduce custom SQL that will land in your `base_events_this_run` table. For more information please feel free to browse our [docs][docs] to get a better understanding of how our individual dbt packages work.

## Usage

In order to include custom entities and SDEs , we set the `snowplow__entities_or_sdes` to have the following value `[{"schema" : "contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_custom_entity_1", "prefix": "custom", "single_entity": true}]`. This pulls the `contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_custom_entity_1` context into the `snowplow_base_events_this_run` table, which is useful if you have a federated table design where the entities are stored in tables separate from the `atomic.events` table. This is generally only the case with Redshift and Postgres setups. We also add custom SQL into the `base_events_this_run` model by specifying the `snowplow__custom_sql` to be `contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_custom_entity_1[0].contents::TEXT as custom_contents`, which will then include this SQL in our `snowplow_base_events_this_run` model, to be able to be used by subsequent models.

# Join the Snowplow community

We welcome all ideas, questions and contributions!

For support requests, please use our community support [Discourse][discourse] forum.

If you find a bug, please report an issue on GitHub.
